result.execSummary:
The defendant John Keith Guyton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm on Grounds of a School, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.605(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: $500.00 fine inclusive of costs to be paid by 10/5/15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment will be ordered.
Provide DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs by 10/5/15.  If not paid, a civil judgment will be ordefred.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; further advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

charges.descr: Possess Firearm on Grounds of a School

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John Keith Guyton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Request for payment of $17  witness fees for witness Cheryl M. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26190301 in court 1x on 8/5/15.
Witness fee request prepared for Cheryl, M. will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.

Matter is recalled. Defendant is no longer requesting a trial. 

Defendant John Keith Guyton in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Amy MacArdy for Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Statements made as to sentencing.  
Court orders $500 FINE inclusive of costs to be paid by 10.5.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment will be ordered. 
Court orders credit for 3 days time served. 
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs by 10.5.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment will be ordered.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant John Keith Guyton in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Amy MacArdy for Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter is scheduled for jury trial. Court holds conference with counsel in chambers off the record. Matter is called on the record. Defense is requesting trial before the Court. Court orders matter passed until 1:30pm.

Defendant John Keith Guyton in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case still in trial posture.   All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse.

Defendant John Keith Guyton in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court denies defense motion.   Case adjourned for final pretrial on 7.20.15 and for jury trial on 8.5.15.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 07-20-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant John Keith Guyton in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for a decision.  Decision scheduled for 04-30-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant John Keith Guyton in court with attorney Michael John Steinle.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Case is adjourned to BRANCH 47 FOR DECISION ON THE MOTION TO DISMISS. LR  Decision scheduled for 02-05-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant John Keith Guyton in court with attorney Michael John Steinle.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 47.  Motion hearing scheduled for 10-30-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael John Steinle in court.  Marissa L. Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Court waives defendants appearance for todays proceedings. Per the Chief Judge, Branch 15 is not keeping this case. Parties advised this case is reassigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47. Case calendared for SCHEDULING on 9/18/2014 at 1:30 pm.

Defendant John Keith Guyton in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Marissa L Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for MOTION HEARING on 9/2/2014 at 1:30 pm. Any motions are to be filed by 7/28/2014 at any response from the State is to be filed by 8/29/2014.
from the Atty. Generals office stating that they are not going to appear for the defense motion. sab

Defendant John Keith Guyton in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Marissa L Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Court is requesting a formal response fron the Attorney Generals office regarding the defense motion. Case calendared for STATUS on 6/27/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.
State's Brief in Opposition to Defendant's Motion to Dismiss Complaint, received and filed. sab
to Dismiss Complaint, received and filed. sab

Defendant John Keith Guyton in court with attorney Michael John Steinle. Randy Sitzberger for Marissa L. Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
 Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Case calendared for MOTION HEARING on 6/12/2014 at 3:00 pm in Branch 15. Any motions are to be filed by 5/9/2014 and any response from the State is to be filed by 6/9/2014.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.

Defendant John Keith Guyton in court with attorney Michael John Steinle.  Hanna Kolberg for Kevin R. Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watts, Br. 15.  Arraignment scheduled for April 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
14RM015214  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 3/14/14
Court ordered no posession of any firearms or weapons.

Defendant John Keith Guyton in court.  Attorney Debra Patterson appearing in court. Joanne L. Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold Defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3-18-14 @ 1:30 P.M.
